meanings.definition: To rearrange or reorganize something, typically in a new or more efficient way.
meanings.sent1: I need to rejig my schedule to fit in more study time.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rejig the layout of her room for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rejig a messy closet can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Let's rejig our approach to this problem and see if it works better.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to rejig the recipe to make it healthier.

meanings.definition: A reorganization or rearrangement of something.
meanings.sent1: The company's rejig led to a more efficient workflow.
meanings.sent2: After the rejig, the office layout felt more spacious.
meanings.sent3: The rejig of the seating plan caused some confusion at first.
meanings.sent4: The rejig of the team structure brought about positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The rejig of the store displays attracted more customers.
